title: .M4A (Apple lossless) files don't play
content:
Transfered my apps, music, photos etc from Xperia to Pixel4a yesterday.
All audio files worked using Music Folder Player on previous device.
The Pixel skips all my M4A music and plays the few MP3's in there. 

Anyone having problems playing M4A's?

Did a quick test, converting an (M4A) album to FLAC and that one WILL play.
It's encoded at 16/48.  
My library has a mix of different rates and bit depths, and I'm not sure if there's a specific combination Pixel dislikes or requires to play M4A.
